intro: Samyda parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered samyda, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Samyda parviflora is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
